sentences.en: Amanda must want to activate the stone dais as well.
sentences.cn: 阿曼达也肯定很想亲手触发那个石祭台.

sentences.en: Dean Blumberg, an associate professor of pediatric infectious disease at UC Dais.
sentences.cn: 加州大学戴维斯分校儿科感染性疾病副教授、医学博士DeanBlumberg说.

sentences.en: Its centerpiece was a communications console on a dais two steps above floor level.
sentences.cn: 它的中心部件是位于地面两级台阶之上的调度台上的通讯控制板.

sentences.en: On the dais, the teacher lounged on his meditation bench in a weathered Patagonia hoodie, his gray hair tied in a knot.
sentences.cn: 在讲台上，身着巴塔哥尼亚帽衫的老师躺在修行台上，灰白的头发打成了一个结。

sentences.en: The Dais in Dehong believe in Buddhism and primitive religion.
sentences.cn: 德宏傣族宗教包括佛教和原始宗教.

sentences.en: The Doll Festival, which takes place on March 3, features dolls representing an emperor and empress along with their attendants on a tiered dais.
sentences.cn: 3月3日举行的女儿节，玩偶的特点是代表天皇和皇后，以及在分层讲台上的服务员。

sentences.en: The forest - worship of the Dais did have positive effects on ecological protection.
sentences.cn: 傣族的山林崇拜对生态保护具有积极意义.

sentences.en: The jewels hissed and evaporated, dissolving into a multicoloured mist that hovered above the dais.
sentences.cn: 宝石嘶嘶作响并蒸发了, 变成了五彩斑斓的薄雾盘旋在祭台上方.

sentences.en: There is a female vice premier, she add colour to our dais today.
sentences.cn: 其中有一位女性副总理，她为我们今天的讲台增加了一点鲜艳的色彩。

sentences.en: There's an inscription on the dais.
sentences.cn: 在那个石台上有一段题词.

sentences.en: Thereby of Zhang Ruimin of sea Er president is on the dais of global fortune forum.
sentences.cn: 海尔总裁张瑞敏藉此走上全球财富论坛的讲台.

sentences.en: Though usually more modest versions are put up in homes, in such places as stores, schools and museums, dolls are displayed on a large tiered, red dais .
sentences.cn: 虽然不少家庭通常都有比较温和的版本，但是在商店，学校和博物馆等场所，玩偶在红色的讲台上一层又一层地显示出来。

sentences.en: Though usually more modest versions are put up in homes, in such places as stores, schools and museums, dolls are displayed on a large tiered, red dais.
sentences.cn: 虽然不少家庭通常都有比较温和的版本，但是在商店，学校和博物馆等场所，玩偶在红色的讲台上一层又一层地显示出来。

sentences.en: When everything was ready , he stepped away from the dais.

trans.tran_en: a low stage in a room that you stand on when you are making a speech or performing, so that people can see and hear you
